javadoc: An interface for a generic random-access byte provider.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the {@link FSRL} of the underlying file for this byte provider, or null if this byte provider is not associated with a file.

@return {@link FSRL} of the underlying file, or null if no associated file.
methods.name: getFSRL
methods.comment:
Returns the FSRL of the underlying file for this byte provider,
 or null if this byte provider is not associated with a file.

return.comment: FSRL of the underlying file, or null if no associated file.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the underlying file for this byte
 provider. Or null if this byte provider is
 not associated with a file.
@return the underlying file for this byte provider
methods.name: getFile
methods.comment:
Returns the underlying file for this byte
 provider. Or null if this byte provider is
 not associated with a file.

return.comment: the underlying file for this byte provider

methods.name: getName
methods.comment:
Returns the name of the byte provider.
 For example, the underlying file name.

return.comment: the name of the byte provider or null

methods.name: getAbsolutePath
methods.comment:
Returns the absolute path (similar to, but not a, URI) to the byte provider.
 For example, the complete path to the file.

return.comment: the absolute path to the byte provider or null

methods.name: length
methods.comment: Returns the length of the underlying provider.

return.comment: the length of the underlying provider

methods.name: isValidIndex
methods.comment: Returns true if the specified index is valid.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index in the byte provider

return.comment: returns true if the specified index is valid

methods.javadoc:
Releases any resources the provider may have occupied.
@throws IOException if an I/O error occurs
methods.name: close
methods.comment: Releases any resources the provider may have occupied.

methods.name: readByte
methods.comment: Reads a byte at the specified index.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index to read the byte

return.comment: the byte read from the specified index

methods.name: readBytes
methods.comment: Reads a byte array at the specified index.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index to read the byte array

params.name: length
params.comment: the number of elements to read

return.comment: the byte array read from the specified index

methods.name: getInputStream
methods.comment:
Returns an input stream to the underlying byte provider starting at
 the specified index
 
 The caller is responsible for closing the returned InputStream instance.

params.name: index
params.comment: the index to initialize the input stream

name: ByteProvider
comment: An interface for a generic random-access byte provider.
